summary: Just finished this cute lil drawing! There are three pages left in this sketchbook, and I don’t know what to do about it. I told...
caption:
Just finished this cute lil drawing! There are three pages left in this sketchbook, and I don’t know what to do about it. I told David Tennant when I last saw him, this is his fault. I’ve never actually filled a sketchbook before. But this is the one he has flipped through and signed now multiple times. The one he stopped with to call my art Brilliant.
Now if I could get Hiddleston to sign this 👀😂

#Loki #MarvelOC #winterclueheart #Marvel #Avengers #OriginalCharacter #Drawing #Art #doodle #sketch #hug #cute
https://www.instagram.com/p/Boygod6DoA5/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=19uox37j4ki28

summary:
– – – --Memories are a funny thing.
 
They keep us going through the darkest of times, they keep us connected to those we love...
caption:
– – – –Memories are a funny thing.

They keep us going through the darkest of times, they keep us connected to those we love most, and they remind us of who we are. Every part of our personalities is made up of a memory and an experience.

So who are we without those memories?

Desperate to defeat the heroes who were proving to be so difficult to kill, Thanos used The Reality Stone to place every single one of them into an alternate world where they had never gotten powers and become heroes. Without the very things that make them special, how can this band of ragtag supers ever hope to regain their real memories and return the world to it’s former state?

Main✤Plot✤Characters?Rules✤Questions

blog.description: You have reached the tumblr of Tony Stark. After making Banner get a blog here I finally gave in and made a public one myself. Ask me things or just enjoy the show, choice is yours. I check the tag "sarcastictonystark" and you can @tag me Not currently accepting M!As Currently accepting compliments None of the images are mine, just the words between them. summary: DADDAAAAAY STARK DO DO DO DODODO DADDY STARK DO DO DO DODODO DADDY STAAAARRK!
body:
Baby Stark

-Peter softly singing “baby Stark” to himself around the tower getting ready for Pepper and Tony’s new baby.

-baby Stark do do do dododo do do baby Stark do do do baby Stark

-But like it once he comes up with it he can’t stop and now he hums/sings it all the time

-Tony throwing pens at him in the lab to get him to shut up, but secretly loving it

-Tony getting caught humming it quietly to himself during in “important UN meeting” when he’s not paying attention

-Rhodey: “Tony wth are you humming?????”

-one day while talking to Pepper’s stomach (to get the baby used to Pepper and Peter’s voices) Peter just starts singing and then looks up at Pepper and breaks out into the second verse for the first time

- Mommy Stark Do Do Do DoDoDo Mommy Stark Do Do Do DoDoDo Mommy Stark!

-Pepper eyes go big in surprise before they glaze a little in joy as she looks softly at Peter.

-Peter grins up at Pepper and they have a moment

-Tony walks in and asks what’s going

-Peter turns his head slowly from where he’s seated on the couch with the mischievous devil’s grin that he learned from Tony himself

-Tony(not even caring what it is): “don”t yoU DaRE!”

-Peter mid-leap directly onto Tony

DADDAAAAAY STARK DO DO DO DODODO DADDY STARK DO DO DO DODODO DADDY STAAAARRK!

title: Hypothermia
body:
Written for day 11 of Whumptober

A/N: Hey, look! I’m two days strong, heck yeah! This next one’s pretty sad, oof, but all in the nature of whump. I’m also not entirely sure if Steve can even get hypothermia, but whatever.

Summary: Steve has finally found some free time to search for Bucky. Unfortunately, Bucky’s last known location is the freezing tundra.

Hypothermia

Steve sighed forlornly, his breath visible in the frigid climate. He was well aware that his Captain America suit, despite its convenience in battle, was the most impractical thing to wear while walking through the tundra. Though he was absolutely freezing, Steve knew that he couldn’t forsake this particular mission. He had spent decades in the ice. A few more hours couldn’t hurt him now. Not to mention, he had a special friend who may have faced the same icy fate; someone who hopefully had survived the same way he had.

The first thing Steve had remembered upon waking up after years of thawing was Bucky’s face when he fell off the side of the train. He wished he could have returned to the frigid, abandoned Hydra facility earlier, but the battle of New York kept him painfully busy. Now that he had time, Steve caught the first plane and began his search.

Hours had passed since Steve had last been in a warm room, but he could do this all day. Time continued to pass slowly and painfully, the frigid wind biting at his face and numbing his fingers. The cold was simply torturous. Sure the punch of an enemy or a bullet wound hurt, but the relentless blowing and biting of the cold winds possessed a far more malevolent temperament and were simply inescapable.  Steve Rogers was no milquetoast coward. He would brave the cold or die trying (though he had been recently questioning his mortality).

Finally, the snow began to raise in certain places, creating the snow covered outlines of an abandoned train track. Steve’s chest filled with both the warmth of reaching his destination and the chilling dread that he’d have to return empty-handed. Breathing deeply, he followed the train-tracks until he reached a snowy, rugged precipice. Looking over the painfully familiar tracks, his breath caught in his throat. It was a long, long fall. Ever so slowly, he climbed down the cliff-side, using his inhuman strength to stop him from plummeting into the snowy valley. The descent was difficult due to his numb fingers and dwindling strength. Still, Steve made it to the bottom, running on the hopes that he’d be reunited with Bucky. Slowly he dragged his feet over the the bank of the icy river, searching for the outline of a body. His search from the bank futile, Steve began to wade into the water, the cold quickly becoming unbearable. Frustration began to bubble up, sending Steve thrashing through the water, travelling further and further downstream.

By the time Steve realized that he would have to return without Bucky, he was beginning to feel very warm, something he was thankful for. All he wanted was to curl up on the side of the river and take a nice nap. Maybe Bucky would be waiting for him then. Or maybe even Peggy. Of course. He owed Peggy a dance. When was it again? Oh yes, that weekend. It would be best if he took a nap now so he’d be rested for later. Nodding to himself, he stumbled out of the river and fell supine on the snowy ground. So warm. So very warm.


Get up. A commanding, British voice said, sounding awfully far away. Get up. You’re not supposed to die of hypothermia. At least go valiantly.

Why are you so rude. Steve clenched his eyes closed. Let me die in peace and join you, Peggy.

Oh heavens no. I’m not even dead yet you imbecile. And neither are you. Now get your stupid arse up and get somewhere warm.

What are you talking about? I’m frozen by now.

You’re a super soldier. I told you get up.


Steve forced his eyes open, sitting up abruptly.

“Whoah, whoah, calm down there.” An elderly man chuckled, placing a wrinkled hand on Steve’s chest. The man pushed him back down, placing the  blankets Steve had previously thrown off over his shoulders again.

“Who are you?” Steve choked out, clearing his throat.

“Oh, so you don’t recognize me?” The old man chuckled again. “Well I guess I didn’t age quite as well as you did, Rogers, but you could at least try to remember your old pal Dugan.”

“It’s been that long.” Steve whispered.

“Hey, I think I look pretty good for my age!” Dugan retaliated, leaning against his metal walker.

“I couldn’t find Bucky.”

“It’s okay. I’m sure he’s fretting in the afterlife about how his little friend is risking his life again. You should be dead anyway. I don’t even know how you’re alive.”

“Me neither.” Steve sighed. He lay on Dugan’s warm bed, waiting for the feeling to return to his limbs before he grabbed a parka and set off into the snow again, headed back to New York, empty handed.

The cold was simply torturous. Sure the punch of an enemy or a bullet wound hurt, but the relentless blowing and biting of the cold winds possessed a far more malevolent temperament and were simply inescapable.  Steve Rogers was no milquetoast coward. He would brave the cold or die trying (though he had been recently questioning his mortality).

Finally, the snow began to raise in certain places, creating the snow covered outlines of an abandoned train track. Steve’s chest filled with both the warmth of reaching his destination and the chilling dread that he’d have to return empty-handed. Breathing deeply, he followed the train-tracks until he reached a snowy, rugged precipice. Looking over the painfully familiar tracks, his breath caught in his throat. It was a long, long fall. Ever so slowly, he climbed down the cliff-side, using his inhuman strength to stop him from plummeting into the snowy valley. The descent was difficult due to his numb fingers and dwindling strength. Still, Steve made it to the bottom, running on the hopes that he’d be reunited with Bucky. Slowly he dragged his feet over the the bank of the icy river, searching for the outline of a body. His search from the bank futile, Steve began to wade into the water, the cold quickly becoming unbearable. Frustration began to bubble up, sending Steve thrashing through the water, travelling further and further downstream.

By the time Steve realized that he would have to return without Bucky, he was beginning to feel very warm, something he was thankful for. All he wanted was to curl up on the side of the river and take a nice nap. Maybe Bucky would be waiting for him then. Or maybe even Peggy. Of course. He owed Peggy a dance. When was it again? Oh yes, that weekend. It would be best if he took a nap now so he’d be rested for later. Nodding to himself, he stumbled out of the river and fell supine on the snowy ground. So warm. So very warm.


Get up. A commanding, British voice said, sounding awfully far away. Get up. You’re not supposed to die of hypothermia. At least go valiantly.

Why are you so rude. Steve clenched his eyes closed. Let me die in peace and join you, Peggy.

Oh heavens no. I’m not even dead yet you imbecile. And neither are you. Now get your stupid arse up and get somewhere warm.

What are you talking about? I’m frozen by now.

You’re a super soldier. I told you get up.


Steve forced his eyes open, sitting up abruptly.

“Whoah, whoah, calm down there.” An elderly man chuckled, placing a wrinkled hand on Steve’s chest. The man pushed him back down, placing the  blankets Steve had previously thrown off over his shoulders again.

“Who are you?” Steve choked out, clearing his throat.

“Oh, so you don’t recognize me?” The old man chuckled again. “Well I guess I didn’t age quite as well as you did, Rogers, but you could at least try to remember your old pal Dugan.”

“It’s been that long.” Steve whispered.

“Hey, I think I look pretty good for my age!” Dugan retaliated, leaning against his metal walker.

“I couldn’t find Bucky.”

“It’s okay. I’m sure he’s fretting in the afterlife about how his little friend is risking his life again. You should be dead anyway. I don’t even know how you’re alive.”

“Me neither.” Steve sighed. He lay on Dugan’s warm bed, waiting for the feeling to return to his limbs before he grabbed a parka and set off into the snow again, headed back to New York, empty handed.

Written for day 11 of Whumptober

A/N: Hey, look! I’m two days strong, heck yeah! This next one’s pretty sad, oof, but all in the nature of whump. I’m also not entirely sure if Steve can even get hypothermia, but whatever.

Summary: Steve has finally found some free time to search for Bucky. Unfortunately, Bucky’s last known location is the freezing tundra.

Hypothermia

Steve sighed forlornly, his breath visible in the frigid climate. He was well aware that his Captain America suit, despite its convenience in battle, was the most impractical thing to wear while walking through the tundra. Though he was absolutely freezing, Steve knew that he couldn’t forsake this particular mission. He had spent decades in the ice. A few more hours couldn’t hurt him now. Not to mention, he had a special friend who may have faced the same icy fate; someone who hopefully had survived the same way he had.

The first thing Steve had remembered upon waking up after years of thawing was Bucky’s face when he fell off the side of the train. He wished he could have returned to the frigid, abandoned Hydra facility earlier, but the battle of New York kept him painfully busy. Now that he had time, Steve caught the first plane and began his search.

Hours had passed since Steve had last been in a warm room, but he could do this all day. Time continued to pass slowly and painfully, the frigid wind biting at his face and numbing his fingers. The cold was simply torturous. Sure the punch of an enemy or a bullet wound hurt, but the relentless blowing and biting of the cold winds possessed a far more malevolent temperament and were simply inescapable.  Steve Rogers was no milquetoast coward. “It’s okay. I’m sure he’s fretting in the afterlife about how his little friend is risking his life again. You should be dead anyway. I don’t even know how you’re alive.”

“Me neither.” Steve sighed. He lay on Dugan’s warm bed, waiting for the feeling to return to his limbs before he grabbed a parka and set off into the snow again, headed back to New York, empty handed.

summary:
~ Shuri and Peter, filling in for Okoye, training the Dora Milaje ~
Shuri: Are you smol beans, women?! 
Dora Milaje: MA'AM NO...
body:
~ Shuri and Peter, filling in for Okoye, training the Dora Milaje ~

Shuri: Are you smol beans, women?!

Dora Milaje: MA'AM NO MA'AM!

Peter: are you ladies heckin DOGGOS?!

Dora Milaje: SIR NO SIR!

Shuri: *points to the Wakandan flag* is that a BIG MOOD?!

Dora Milaje: MA'AM YES MA'AM!

blog.name: criticnthecynic
blog.title: The Cynic and the Critic
blog.description: Welcome to the critic and the cynic blog, where we post notes on what we discuss in our podcast, Editorials and movie reviews that are all based around our obsession with movie franchises and how they function.

summary: Our First Episode of the new franchise based podcast Critic and the Cynic is now LIVE!! check it out on...
body:
Our First Episode of the new franchise based podcast Critic and the Cynic is now LIVE!! check it out on sc: https://soundcloud.com/critic-n-synic/finally-on-the-air-talking-marvel-on-critic-and-the-cynic-episode-01

were discussing Marvel exclusively this week, but next week were gonna talk a whole lot more franchise material and blockbuster goodness.
